p: In contrast to the members of the Nucleorhabdovirus genus (Mononegavirales) to which they are most closely related [ 2], members of the Dichorhavirus genus have bipartite genomes, although their coding capacity is about the same as that of the plant-adapted rhabdoviruses (approzimately 14 kb) [ 3]. All dichorhaviruses are transmitted by species of false spider mite, Brevipalpus spp., with orchid fleck virus (OFV) being the type species [ 3, 4]( Fig 2).
